thread.title: Theresa May to face vote of confidence on Wednesday after Brexit deal chaos

author: Sophie Barley
title: Theresa May to face vote of confidence on Wednesday after Brexit deal chaos
text:
Theresa May to face vote of confidence on Wednesday after Brexit deal chaos Enough Conservative MPs have requested a vote of confidence in Theresa May to trigger a contest Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
It has been confirmed that a vote of confidence in Theresa May will take place on Wednesday night.
The threshold of 15% of the parliamentary party seeking a vote of confidence in the leader of the Conservative Party has been exceeded.
It was announced on Wednesday morning by chairman of the backbench 1922 Committee Sir Graham Brady. Read More Theresa May Brexit deal latest LIVE: Prime Minister faces vote of no confidence from Tory MPs
The vote will take place tonight between 6-8pm, with the result expected to be announced shortly after.
Sir Graham Brady has received at least 48 letters from Conservative MPs calling for a vote of no confidence in May.
Under party rules, a contest is triggered if 15% of Conservative MPs write to the chair of the committee of Tory backbenchers. Read More Next Prime Minister odds: Who could replace Theresa May if she resigns over Brexit chaos
In a press release, he said: "The threshold of 15% of the parliamentary party seeking a vote of confidence in the leader of the Conservative party has been exceeded."
The Prime Minister has come under pressure from all sides over her Brexit negotiations - and on Monday she made the shock announcement that a much-anticipated 'meaningful vote' on her withdrawal arrangement would be delayed, as she looked to avoid a potentially career-ending defeat.
